programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Breaking Mysterious
programme.desc: Witness what could be the first-ever audio recording of New Mexicos bizarre Taos Hum, which many say has been plaguing the area for decades. Plus, paranormal activity in Oklahoma and other strange phenomena.

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Follow legendary archeologist Dr Zahi Hawass as he discovers new archeological finds while managing 250 digs throughout Egypt. He and his team unearth new treasures, ranging from incredibly preserved mummies to, perhaps, Cleopatras tomb.

programme.title: Engineering An Empire
programme.desc: Engineering an Empire focuses on the architectural triumphs of great civilisations, from Ancient Greece and the Aztecs to the Mayans, Chinese, Russians, Carthaginians, Persians and Byzantines.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Digging deeper into reports about the Fourth Reich, Bob and John send the team to a rumoured weapons testing site in Germany, and a mysterious deserted island in Argentina that could have housed nuclear facilities with Nazi ties after the war.

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: A range of geology, climatology and archaeology experts give their conclusions as to what life could be like on Earth if the human race dies out.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: In major cities around the world today, skyscrapers loom overhead, taxis honk their horns and street vendors peddle their wares. But below lies city upon city. ‘Cities of the Underworld’ explores this fascinating and unknown history.

programme.title: The Universe

programme.title: Engineering An Empire

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: Closer than ever to the $200 million payday, Wayne and the team head into the heart of darkness where a cryptic find weaves an even bigger mystery.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: Historical clues and the expertise of geologists reveal how powerful forces shaped the planet.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: This mini-series looks into the history and beliefs behind religions that have shaped the universe. The show unearths alternative suggestions, poses questions and challenges the accepted, opening a whole new world on the history of the universe.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The mysterious Mediterranean island of Malta lies south of Sicily and is home to megalithic structures built by a mysterious prehistoric society. Who were the people that built these sophisticated structures?

programme.title: The Search For The Tesla Files
programme.desc: The team investigates Nikola Teslas final residence, The New Yorker Hotel, and find incredible evidence that it served as much more than a home to the controversial inventor.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, an expert on H2’s ‘Ancient Aliens’, is continually asked to visit sites and speak about the topics covered in the series. This show explores the possibility of a spin-off series, with Giorgio himself as the featured talent.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob and John head to Northern Spain, where a declassified document shows Hitler could have moved there from Denmark. They discover several eye witnesses, a satellite of the Third Reich, and what could be a Nazi communications center.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: ‘Missing in Alaska’ investigates the region of northwest Alaska, where over 20,000 people have vanished in an area locals call the Alaska Triangle. In all these cases, the bodies are rarely discovered. Who or whats behind these cases is unknown.

programme.desc: Spencer drops into the shop with some tasty new finds, but will Rick bite? Then, Chum and Rick meet up with a magician selling a zig zag box. Can they conjure up an offer? Corey finds himself flustered over a necklace, made of ancient coins.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the worlds top ten mysterious devices, from strange, grooved disks found in a cave in China to an ancient Greek computer. Might these sensational artefacts provide evidence of extraterrestrial visitation?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Enormous manmade caves... Unexplainable structures... And underwater discoveries that challenge everything we know about the past...Is it possible that an advanced civilization inhabited Earth thousands of years ago?

programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum explore the Wolverines lair, facing mishaps with a Thunderbird, winning a "Star Wars" collection with the force, and snagging a signed jersey from football legend LaMarr Woodley, who later surprises them.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While a trip to Europe continues to uncover clues connecting the Templars to Scandinavian culture and Oak Island, on Oak Island, a clue found beneath a Nolans Cross boulder may offer answers the team has been desperate for.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: All over the world, there are places and objects that are considered cursed. Many people avoid these places and things because they believe they will bring them misfortune. Others believe that curses are nothing more than superstition and folkloric legends. Are curses merely the product of an overactive imagination or the byproduct of eerie coincidences? Or is it possible that these curses are real—and that dark forces are at work that cannot be explained?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick reels in an antique glass fishing buoy made in Japan, he hopes the seller’s price floats his boat. Meanwhile, Chum checks out a rare dinosaur fossil. Can he dig up a good price, or will the seller have a bone to pick with him?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: In a pawn shop far away, Rick and Corey unbox a skateboard signed by Carrie Fisher. Then, Corey has a first-person encounter with “Halo: Combat Evolved.” Will he be the Master Chief of this deal? Chum is stunned by a vintage Versace collection.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down ten of the most intriguing and mysterious symbols and codes found that just might contain proof of otherworldly contact. From glyphs in the Peruvian desert, to spiral petroglyphs embedded with advanced mathematics.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Ancient Astronaut theorists have long proposed that Earth is an extraterrestrial laboratory. If so, does it extend beyond humans into the animal kingdom? Accounts of animalist gods can be found across the globe that curiously mirror alien encounters.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: We humans want to boldly go into uncharted territories to make new discoveries. As the next era of space exploration begins, what will we find when we reach other planets? What dangers will we face when we try to conquer these new frontiers?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: This week, Rick, Corey, and Chum are hoping to strike it rich in the Mill City, Minneapolis, Minnesota. While there, the guys have a brush with a happy little Bob Ross painting, tackle a jersey signed by the Minnesota Vikings Purple People Eaters, and try to take home a prized vintage arcade collection. Later, the trio sink their teeth into some Juicy Lucys.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While a trip to Europe continues to uncover clues connecting the Templars to Scandinavian culture and Oak Island, on Oak Island, a clue found beneath a Nolans Cross boulder may offer answers the team has been desperate for.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: All over the world, there are places and objects that are considered cursed. Many people avoid these places and things because they believe they will bring them misfortune. Others believe that curses are nothing more than superstition and folkloric legends. Are curses merely the product of an overactive imagination or the byproduct of eerie coincidences? Or is it possible that these curses are real—and that dark forces are at work that cannot be explained?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick reels in an antique glass fishing buoy made in Japan, he hopes the seller’s price floats his boat. Meanwhile, Chum checks out a rare dinosaur fossil. Can he dig up a good price, or will the seller have a bone to pick with him?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Human can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable. Is cheating death when survival is seemingly impossible simply fate or good fortune?

programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are ready to wrangle some wild deals in the Lone Star State. Along the way, the guys test-drive a 1968 Buick Riviera, become riveted by a blacksmiths anvil collection, and meet up with NFL legend, Emmitt Smith.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are fishin for big deals in the Sunshine State! Between beach days and dinner with WWE superstar Titus ONeil, the gang is casting a wide net in St. Petersburg, Florida.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: In an all-UFO special, Tony Harris breaks down the latest developments and most compelling photographic evidence in a tumultuous year of UFO revelations. Did the most recent UAP incidents present a threat to national security?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A lone wolf prisoner, with aspirations of writing crime novels, ends up the star of his own break out story when he figures out how to escape from one of Mississippis oldest and most notorious prison farms, Parchman Penitentiary.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A German American pilot, Dieter Dengler, uses survival skills honed as a child to escape a secret prison in Laos in the early years of the Vietnam war.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: Earths moon is only one of hundreds in the solar system, each of them a mysterious and often bizarre world. Could alien moons offer a key to exploring outer space and perhaps even finding a new home for humanity?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Across the globe, reports of mysterious glowing orbs are on the rise. Their movements defy the laws of physics, and now they are even being reported near military bases and nuclear weapon facilities. Do they represent a non-human intelligence?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A German American pilot, Dieter Dengler, uses survival skills honed as a child to escape a secret prison in Laos in the early years of the Vietnam war.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy does a BIG sneeze and finds he had a tiny hair in his nose! But its so small he loses it immediately... This gets him wondering, whats the smallest thing there is?! Messy goes to Okido to find Zoe and Felix just in time to catch Zim star as guest on Mayor Okis TV show! Mayor Oki introduces Zim, Okidos expert on everything! but Mayor Oki thinks he knows better than Zim “everything in the world is made of sandwiches” he says! Zim corrects him, “actually Mr Mayor, everything in the world is made of something very small, we call them atoms”.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry make the final preparations for the contest. Strawberry offers the twins to be models at the contest instead of her. Sweet is delighted, but Sour is not excited. Shortly before the show is broadcast, Sour sabotages the TV equipment.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is reluctant to have a bath so he goes to Dino-World where he endeavours to become as dirty and stinky as he possibly can.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harrys friend Charlie brings her new kitten (Buster) to visit Harry.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A trip to the rainforest becomes necessary when a clouded leopard cub turns up in the garden. The Junior Rangers search for the cub’s mother, but are set back when the cub gets entangled in some tree vines above water.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: One day Bill and Ben tell Timothy he needs to find a truck that is blue and red and yellow and brown. Bill and Ben insist the truck is real, so Timothy sets off to look for it. Bill and Ben think they are very funny, but Timothy has the last laugh when he actually finds some trucks that match their description and brings back smelly rubbish trucks bound for the dump.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Marion has been digging along the mainline and is spending the night sleeping on a siding. A sound wakes her up and she sees a long line of dinosaurs going past in the moonlight! Marion thinks it must be a dream and tells Thomas as much the next day, but then the dinosaurs return and chase Marion all that way up to the castle. Where, thankfully, she discovers that they’re actually model dinosaurs for the Earl’s new Dinosaur Park!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Maria ordered way too much stock and if she doesnt sell hundreds of pizzas today, everything will be ruined! Grisu offers to do some advertising to bring people in. After a shooting session, Grisu Stella and Fume distribute and stick flyers and posters around the city. But Fume overzealous sticks his posters anywhere. Grisu has to catch up with his fathers mistakes and ends up burning the cart full of flyers. After his despair moment, Grisu has the idea to do an air show. With his father, they draw a giant pizza in the sky, made with colored smoke...and it works.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Stella is taking part in a dance video contest and she asks Grisu to dance along with her. The young dragon accepts immediately. But as soon as they start filming, Fume comes in and asks his son to do dragon training with him. He then unwittingly makes Grisu fall and botches the shot. From then on, Stella and Grisu keep changing location so that they can shoot in a "quiet" place, meaning without Fume. But the older dragon shows up anyway and ruins the shot, albeit unvoluntarily.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare awakes to find the leaves changing colour and falling off the trees, the flowers dropping off the bushes and the tadpoles turning into frogs. Autumn is here and it’s time for change! Little Nutbrown Hare misses the joys of the Summer meadow. Will he discover that Autumn has it’s own delights?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox has brought some elderberries for the children. Unknown to the others, Edmund swallows one and then learns that the number had been calculated so that each child received the same amount of berries. Edmund slips away to find another elderberry. Meanwhile, the children share out the berries and find that there are three left over. What should they do ? There seems to be no simple solution…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Mila is appearing on the children’s TV game show, “Whiz-A-Quiz”, the rest of the Spring City Rockets are disappointed that they didn’t get tickets to watch and support her. This gives Mayor Madison the idea for Bob to build an outdoor movie area at the Stadium where everyone can watch the game show together. But when Mayor Madison asks Lofty to help the Spring City Rockets decorate the stadium, he gets carried away and leaves Leo to finish the support frames for the giant screen all by himself. A job that is too big for one person. When the giant screen arrives, the frame isn’t sturdy enough to hold it and the whole structure starts falling apart. Lofty races in and saves the TV screen but the frame, stage and audience seating are broken.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a playful young orangutan in his garden. With the orangutan in tow, the Junior Rangers travel to the Indonesian island of Sumatra to look for the orangutan’s mother.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers make a trip to the jungle to reunite a shy pangolin with its mother. There, the Junior Rangers come face to face with a ferocious tiger!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Grandma tells the tale of the legendary Popolino to motivate Simon on their hike through the mountains. Will they see the legendary creature when they reach the lake?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pandos brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch boxes get mixed up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda launches an herbal delivery service, and demand is huge. But Billy and Benny mix up orders: now Rupert cant sleep, and Robin sleeps through his morning song. Tilda must fix the chaos.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds soapbox cars, and Billy and Benny race them excitedly. Edna thinks its too dangerous and secures the track, while Karl and Molly struggle with near-sightedness and fear.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare has a lot to do today. Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse promise to help but there are so many wonderful distractions they forget their promise and let Big Nutbrown Hare down. Luckily they learn a valuable lesson from some bees and get busy to make to things right!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Its Little Field Mouses birthday and Little Nutbrown Hare wants to give her exactly the right gift. After a moment’s thought he realises he has no idea what to give her. Big Nutbrown Hare encourages his son to think about everything he knows about his friend. He remembers she likes to look nice on her birthday, so her makes her a lovely necklace and she is delighted!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare keeps winning a game with Little Field Mouse, and enjoys it so much he doesnt realise she is frustrated with losing. Big Nutbrown Hare helps him realise that winning is less important than making sure everyone enjoys playing the game. So Little Nutbrown Hare invents a new game that Little Field Mouse and her twin siblings can enjoy playing too.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster and Wilson compete to earn their ‘Helping Wheels’ badge. However they get so caught up trying to outdo each other, that they don’t help anyone. Koko beats them to it, winning her badge by helping a little girl rescue her kite. In the end, Wilson and Brewster help each other out and decide to work together as a team to earn their badge.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle invites Leo, Katie and Hero to scuba-dive at the beach. Its a beach party! The boys bust out their signature animal dance moves. Just as Kyle does the dolphin, he spots a big-belly seahorse bullying another big-belly seahorse. On closer inspection, the rangers realise that theres no bullying. On the contrary, the seahorses are in love. But it seems its going to take a lot more work for the male seahorse before the female accepts him. The rangers are on it!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Mountain Gorillas have elected a new leader... Ranger Rocky! But wheres the original silverback leader?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi loves eating Fred’s goat’s cheese… but thinks again after getting a whiff of the goats’ pen: Ew!... So he’s very happy when Nina suggests they clean it out! Once they’re done with the cleaning, the two friends decide they could also make it more cozy. But shhh, not a word to anyone: it’s a surprise! However, after making the pen all spic and span and super comfortable, they’re shocked to find that the smell is still there!?! Thinking he’s found the perfect solution, Tchoupi sprays Mom’s perfume inside the pen… But what do the goats’ think of this new scent inside their house…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out walking in the forest, Benedicte sets a challenge for Tchoupi and Nina – to find their way back home all by themselves, using landmarks they come across along the way. But when they spot a squirrel, they momentarily forget to pay attention, and stray from the path back home...

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Loupiote the dog is feeling particularly playful this morning! She grabs T’choupi’s stuffed and runs off to bury it in a secret location! T’choupi manages to get his plush bear back… but its fur is covered in mud! Dad washes it… but now it’s all wet and will never be dry by tonight! Tchoupi feels down: how will he be able to sleep without his precious teddy bear?! He sets off on a quest to find a replacement… but comes back empty-handed. Nina thinks she just may have a solution: what if she were to teach him how to get to sleep… “Teddy-less?...!”

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today it is Charley’s turn to feed Splash. But what’s this…? Splash has completely lost his appetite!! Nothing tempts him, neither clean water nor fresh food…. What if the fish is really ill? All there is left to do is call Charley’s veterinarian father who might be able to explain what is wrong…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: In the courtyard, Sam and Julia have discovered that snowflakes are formed by beautiful little stars. But how can they preserve these wonders and show them to Julias mom before it melt?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Which child will get the big spoon for the annual fondue held in memory of the very first residents of th Mouse Mansion. Sam and Julia are in competition, will their friendship hold up?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Samson boasts proudly that he has been given a very special job taking stone from the quarry to the docks. But when he learns that Thomas has been given the same job he tries to find another way to prove how important he is. So he decides to take much more trucks than he should insisting that this will save time. But with so many heavy trucks Samson can’t get over Gordon’s Hill. So it takes even longer and when he asks Thomas to help him, he ends up making Thomas late too. The Fat Controller is not happy, but Samson insists that he’s learned his lesson and won’t make the same mistake again…

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Judy and Jerome, the breakdown train, have been stuck at Knapford Yard for some time – having been somewhat superseded by Rocky and even Harvey. Ryan hears their sad story and offers to take them to Arelsburgh Harbour for a change of scenery. They love it there at first but soon take advantage of other engines so they can have a tour around the island. Meanwhile, Daisy has a run in with a bull and is derailed. When Thomas goes looking for the breakdown train, it is nowhere to be found! Ryan feels responsible – not just for Daisy but also to make sure Judy And Jerome get to be Really Useful. Ryan catches up with Judy and Jerome in the end and The Fat Controller is reminded how useful they can be. He decides they will have a new home at Arlesburgh with their friends Ryan and Daisy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous class pet - Gerald the Hamster - passes away the night before Caillou is due to take him home for the weekend.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Rosie is scared to go to the dentist for the first time, so Caillou tries to prove its not as scary as it seems!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Ever tried making a hay tower? Well Monkey did only not very successfully and when it was time to clean things up he got some unexpected help from his friend the horse. Horse was eager to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Dilys takes her eye off the stove for a split second, the Cut Price Store catches on fire, trapping Norman upstairs!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: An underwater shoot goes wrong when James gets wedged in the rocks, just as the tide starts coming in!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat delivers a precious Indian elephant to Meera for her school show and tell.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger goes for a walk with Rosie and her father, Basil. During the walk, Scoutbadger discovers that the flamboyant Basil, who tells him stories that fire his imagination, is more at ease with the tales he tells than with reality.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie talks too much. She has told the twins that her best friend, Biva, is going to meet Loudo. The two brothers are extremely excited at the news and decide to spy on the two children. This is a catastrophe for Rosie - unless…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky and Bubble learn a choreography together, but Sketcky does not know how to do somersaults. Doodleboo knows someone who could teach him how to do it.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Friend Philivert is celebrating his birthday. Only problem: crossing the wild jungle. Help Sketcky find which companion can help them cross the city.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty helps Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave make toy sailing boats and race them down the river. Discovering which things float and what makes a great sail makes it an exciting race to the finish!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave invent blue-panda waker-uppers to help Dave get up in the mornings. Their wacky inventions ensure that Dave won’t miss out on any fun by napping too long!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Walking on stilts is difficult even for a talented athlete like Monkey; And it is even more difficult if one stilts breaks and the other gets stuck in the mud…but not to worry, Flamingo is here to save the day. Once out of the mud, Monkey invites Flamingo to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger (wearing his proper farmer’s boots), Pig and Arnold are off to the farm. Arnold finds a large white egg and makes a nest for it in his buggy. The others tease him, but soon the egg hatches and a duckling appears. It joins it’s mother duck and six brothers and sisters and soon Kipper with Arnold on his shoulders, Tiger slipping in the mud as he carries the buggy, and finally Pig, join the end of the fluffy procession.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: It’s Jake’s birthday and everyone seems to have forgotten. He wishes for a big birthday party with all his friends. Kipper arrives – but he just wants to take Jake to the park. Luckily Kipper can’t keep a secret and Jake’s wish comes true.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are having fun discovering various animals’ houses. When they realize butterflies don’t have a house, they decide to build a beautiful "Butterfly Hotel!" But when the edifice is finally ready… another animal - one that is not at all to T’choupi’s liking - moves in instead!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Nina asks T’choupi to accompany her to the forest for a fitness session, our little hero gets very excited… until they reach the location and there’s no fitness trail in sight! Nina laughs: that’s the funnest part about it - they’ll use the tree trunks, boulders and branches to make their own parcourse! T’choupi drags his heels as he follows Nina through the "trail." Then, when he trips and falls, he wants to call it quits… But what if he were to invent his very own fitness trail in the forest? Wouldn’t that be fun…?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia realizes that, despite her efforts to fit in, she will never share all the memories the children have made living in the Mouse Mansion. Sam will help her overcome this difficulty.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: A tiring gardening session make the friends of Wild Rose Lane dream of going away on holiday. But none of them wants to be all alone in far-off places. So Tilda suggests that they simply swap homes. No sooner said than done! Tilda moves in to Ednas, Molly to Ruperts, Robin to Tildas, the squirrels to Mollys and Rupert to Robins.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: 24 days seem like a very long wait until Christmas. But the Triplets may have an idea to speed up time. What if they ate all the chocolates from their Christmas calendar at once? Of course, Mom is not happy and warns them: they had better be good, because Santa is watching and doesn’t bring gifts to kids who do not behave! Oh no, they only have three weeks to make up for a whole year of silly things!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa and Grandma have come to look after the children. In the afternoon, Grandma goes for a walk in the forest with Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry. Grandpa stays in the burrow with Woodsy who thinks he is going to have a quiet time but things turn out to be more hectic than he had anticipated.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a rainy day, while Mommy is out and Daddy is working, Caillou andRosie struggle with boredom. On a suggestion from Daddy, Caillou andRosie use crayons and their imagination to make their own fun, and tellthe story of Mommys epic quest to bring home pizza for their dinner.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou wants to be just like the Red Racer on TV - but hes tooyoung to drive a real car... Luckily, Mommy can build Caillou hisvery own Go-Kart!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Kevin is very excited by the snow, but Victor doesn’t like it at all. He explains to Kevin that the snow is causing all sorts of trouble. Emily is stuck in the Steamworks, because the parts she is waiting for are on a truck that’s stuck in the snow at the depot. When Kevin goes outside some snow falls off the roof trapping him too. Victor thinks Kevin’s gone to try to fetch the truck from the depot and sets off to rescue his friend. Luckily Thomas has been sent to the depot too and is able to find Victor before anyone else gets stuck in the snow!

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: The Mayor asks Brewster to make a film about Chuggington and he has to learn to make the best of what he has.

programme.title: Chuggington 04
programme.desc: Koko is told an important secret and struggles to keep it to herself.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today it is Charley’s turn to feed Splash. But what’s this…? Splash has completely lost his appetite!! Nothing tempts him, neither clean water nor fresh food…. What if the fish is really ill? All there is left to do is call Charley’s veterinarian father who might be able to explain what is wrong…

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave use all of their five senses, seeing, hearing, smell, taste and touch to find each other, and Hatty’s hat, in a fun game of Hide and Seek.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its bedtime but wheres Hoppity? Bing remembers playing with him in the garden so Flop finds a torch and together they set off in the dark for an adventure.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you get stuck, you need some help and then you can get down by yourself.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s winter, the yard is covered in snow. Simon’s friends, Ferdinand and Mamadou suggest they have a sled race. Simon thinks this is an awesome idea! They decide that Simon will team up with his brother Gaspard on one sled and Ferdinand and Mamadou on the other. Simon complains. His brother is too small, he’s sure to lose! The first races are indeed a bit of a fiasco and Simon gets annoyed at his brother and so Gaspard goes home to sulk. That is until Simon realizes that Gaspard can actually help him win…because he’s lighter! And what if we always needed someone smaller than ourselves to win?!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy has gone camping with Loudo and his father and Scoutbadger finds himself alone. Unexpectedly, Scoutbadger is unsettled by his twin’s absence. He is sure that being twins creates a special link between them and now senses that Woodsy is in great danger. He wants to find out what is happening.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Annalee is mysteriously preparing for a celebration, but she doesnt tell Boribon why. When Boribon asks, she simply says its a secret. Boribon gets upset at first, but he soon cheers up when the mystery is finally revealed.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Despite all Mommies’ effort to fix it, there is nothing to do, the door of the Triplet’s closet is definitely broken. It opens automatically every time someone closes it and it makes an awful shrilling noise. Instantly, the Triplet’s imagination goes wild, all the more that they just read a book about a knight ghost who haunts a dirty old castle. For them there is not doubt, their closet is haunted! What reassures not at all Poet, or Toto!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: "Tomorrow is my birthday", claims Girl, but Poet and Turbulent disagree: "No, mine!" they both answer. Mom explains that Triplets have the same birthday. The Triplets are quite disappointed, they each wanted to have their own party and their very own cake. However, Grandpa has an idea: he takes them to the countryside and shows Girl a rose bush which he created especially for her, lends a little plane to Turbulent, as well as a spyglass to Poet. At first, they are each extremely happy...but it is a lot more fun to share your presents, right?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko’s speed booster malfunctions and she speeds around Chuggington out of control. Chug Patrol get ready to rescue her with some strong nets, but even they can’t stop Koko. Brewster has been crushing rocks and saves the day by dropping dust onto Koko, which clogs up her booster and finally brings her to a standstill.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Charlie takes Sarah, Mandy and Norman out to sea. But the kids tussle over who should be captain until Charlie is knocked into the sea and Norman causes the engine to catch fire.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: While Lizzie teaches at the Fire Station, Norman and Hannah help keep things running at the Pontypandy Vets… except both sheep manage to escape AND Norman startles Prince the horse, who runs away and gets stuck in sinking mud at the tidal flats!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Tigers very excited when his new rocket arrives. Hes not so excited when it refuses to take off. With a bit of help from Kipper and Sock Thing, everything works out fine.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig suggests Kipper takes some of his unwanted things to a jumble sale. He points out that if Kipper gets rid of old stuff, he will have more room for new stuff. Kipper is almost convinced until he realises his precious comics have to go.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou gets the giggles at school, his silliness disrupts the rest of the class. In a rodeo fantasy, an announcer’s (Leo) silly antics are distracting to Buck Buckaroo (Caillou), and Caillou learns that being silly is great, but sometimes you have to shake your sillies out for your friends.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Daddy has to stop playing with Caillou and Leo to run an errand, the boys try to stop Daddy from leaving. Then in a farmer fantasy where a farmer and his farm hand (Caillou and Leo) are bombarded by clingy sheep, Caillou and Leo learn that they can have fun while they wait for Daddy to return.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while levelling the site for Wellsworth Hospital’s new parking lot/car park, Brenda finds that someone had dumped a large mound of stone right in her cleaned-up work site. She thinks Monty and Max are responsible and so she clears the stone away. Little did she know that it was the stone for filling in the hospital’s extension foundations Jack and Alfie have just dug out. They wonder what became of the stone when they arrive to collect it. Miss Jenny asks for Nia to bring more stone from the quarry but even that load goes missing, not long after Jack unloads it. Where could it have gone to? Everyone soon finds the answer and the outcome is also quite convenient for both the pack and Brenda.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A stinky Hero seeks grooming advice from the Ring-tailed Lemurs.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers help Peyo befriend a Llama.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Julian and the kids at Greendale School are excited about a Festival of flight - Ted’s coming to talk about aviation and Alf’s bringing Cedric the racing pigeon. Pat has to deliver special jet boots to the school, built by Ted’s inventor friend. Ted will demonstrate them. But on the way to Greendale, Pat stops to help Alf, whose cows have got loose. Pat sees Ajay, out for a day’s bird-watching. Pat has promised to lend Ajay his wellies and asks Ajay to get them from the van, but Ajay takes the jet boots by mistake.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat tries to deliver to the school and find a new lamb on Greendale Fell at the same time.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bing accidentally leaves his Hoppity Voosh toy at the park, Amma helps Bing focus and retrace his steps to find it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Pongo, a loveable Chinese dragon, becomes Oswalds best friend after Oswald helps him out of a tough spot. But Pongo is so big and clumsy he creates havoc. Pongo decides he just doesnt belong, but Oswald shows him that clumsy or not, Pongo fits in wherever he is.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie are preparing to race in the Big City Go-Kart Race. But Oswald is so busy helping his friends get ready, he misses the start. He trails, but catches up quickly as everyone else’s go-karts fall apart. Oswald gives them all a lift and they cross the finish line together to share first prize - a trophy full of ice cream.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is looking after Curtis’s garage while Leo takes him out for a birthday meal at Chef Tattie’s. However, the meal is a ruse, arranged so that Bob and his gang can secretly give Curtis’ workshop a makeover. Scoop is excited to be at the garage; he claims to have a great knowledge of mechanics. The build is all on schedule until Bob is forced to attend to Mr Bentley who keeps him busy because he’s very fussy about how much air he has in Philip’s tyres. At the restaurant Curtis is keen to get back to the garage as he is nervous about leaving it in somebody else’s hands. When Bob rings Leo and asks him to play for time Leo orders more and more food for himself to eat. At the, now busy, garage Scoop decides to take a look at what’s troubling Betsy, using the new vehicle inspection lift.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building Spring City’s new Ice Rink when the Rockets arrive and plead with him to finish it as soon as possible. They explain that the rink they were going to be playing on that evening is out of action and they have no-where to play! Bob tells them he’ll do his best and the building begins. Muck is fascinated by the idea of Ice Hockey and when Bob and Wendy set off to get the clear plastic panels to fit in the barrier surrounds, Muck decides to have a little go himself. Despite Leo’s protestations, all the machines are soon skidding about on the ice causing mayhem! When Bob and Wendy arrive back, they are alarmed to see all the barriers knocked down! Muck says sorry but Bob knows that the Rockets will be back very soon and they need to work fast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s dressing up time and Timmy plays Doctor! Poor Teddy is sick, can you help Timmy put some plasters on Teddy to make him better?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is running around. He runs so fast that he can feel his heart beating loudly! Why is that happening all of a sudden? "When you need to know, go to Okido!" Messy lands in Okido onto Zoe and Felixs trampoline. They all jump off, and they notice all their hearts are beating loudly but they don’t know why... Zim and Zam will know though, so off they go to see them. Zim, Zam and Zoom are baking a cake. Zim startles as they enter the lab, he was whisking so fast that his cake mix flies out of his hands and lands all over Zoom!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is having fun on his swing. Back and forth he goes but suddenly it breaks! A disappointed Messy goes off go to Okido to find out why! He lands in Felix and Zoes garden but cant see them anywhere. To Messy’s surprise, out they jump from behind something strange… “Where did these metal trees come from?” Messy asks them and discovers that they arent trees, theyre legs! In fact, theyre legs of Stan Tall, Okidos biggest robot who is helping Zim build a bridge today. So Messy whistles the Okidoodle over and they race Stan to the seaside to get started!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero travel to Peru to take a marvellous spatuletail home. But what can they do when the hungry bird falls into a deep sleep?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: The first time Samson came to Sodor he got lost. But Samson is a very proud engine and he doesn’t like to admit his mistakes. So he finds it very hard to listen to the other engines trying to warn him that he is making a mistake again when he accidentally takes Gordon’s Express Coaches to the quarry, instead of the trucks used for carrying stone.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Scruff breaks down and has to be sent to the Steamworks, Samson is given the job of collecting up the track-side scrap. But Samson ends up taking his new responsibilities a little too seriously and collects up everything from the postman’s bike to the Fat Controller’s car. The Fat Controller has to race off to save it before it ends up getting crunched by Reg’s claw!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles. Grisu and Stella have to discover how to steer a herd, especially a stubborn black sheep. Not an easy mission but as ever, a fire fighter never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The Dragon Stone, a beautiful and rare stone that Grisus ancestors found centuries ago breaks accidently. It was supposed to be the main stone of an exhibition that Professor Smeraldo has set up. To avoid cancelling the exhibition, Grisu, Fume and Stella go to explore a cave where they might find another legendary Dragon Stone. But the expedition turns into an adventure when they realize that only the two kids are able to go through the very small entrance of the cave. The quest quickly appears to be a big task for such young kids, even if one of them is a dragon. But thanks to their tenacity (fire-fighters never give up!), Grisu and Stella will be able to find the legendary stone and to find their way back. The exhibition will be saved!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As Woodsy is going to sleep over at Loudo’s, there is a spare place in the burrow. Rosie wants to invite Biva but Scoutbadger wants to invite Martis. Edmund, who does not like it when things get too boisterous, says only one friend can come. Scoutbadger and Rosie quarrel over which one can invite their best friend…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Hero comes across an egg in the garden. To Leo’s surprise, a baby Komodo dragon hatches from the egg instead of a baby bird. The Junior Rangers decide to bring the Komodo dragon back to the island it comes from.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo and Hero meet a koala in their garden. The Junior Rangers head Down Under to find a home for the koala, but a pack of wild dogs gets in their way.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The whole family is going canoeing, and to make things even more exciting, theres going to be a race - Gaspard and Mummys boat against Simon and Daddys boat!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda and Rupert are on a boat trip when they suddenly find themselves stranded on dry land. Where has the water gone? They meet Berta, the beaver girl, and discover her dam is the cause.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Billy loses his baby tooth and places it under his pillow. He and Benny want to see the Tooth Fairy, so they stay awake. Eventually, they go out at night searching for her.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda Appleseed is overwhelmed by the many tasks in her guesthouse. But when she observes calm Snaily, she realizes that she can accomplish everything in a relaxed manner and one step at a time.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Koko and Brewster must keep to a schedule picking up passengers. Koko is too eager and gets ahead of schedule, while Brewster is too cautious and gets behind schedule – but in the end, they both learn to run on time!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Two Panther Chameleons who want the same tree! The competition is on!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle invites Leo, Katie and Hero out on a hike in New Zealand. A mischievous bird decides to join them as they prepare for the hike. Unfortunately, hes a little too mischievous and steals the key to PlatypusOne. The rangers are on it!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Luce are awe - struck when they find out that Ciboulette the cat has just had kittens! Dad asks them to leave the babies alone as they need peace and quiet in order to grow. But the two friends go to see Ciboulette and her adorable kittens over and over, behind Dad’s back. Until… all the cats go missing!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina and her father, who are preparing a delicious dessert with yummy blackberries from the woods, Tchoupi wants to make his own recipe from a forest ingredient. Easier said than done: chestnuts or mushrooms aren’t always easy to find… especially when there’s a greedy squirrel roaming nearby!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is pretending to Nina that he’s able to read… but loses track of the story he’s trying to tell. An idea suddenly springs to mind: why doesn’t he just make up the rest of the story, in real life?!... The only thing they need to make it complete is a little chick to play the hero of their adventure. But when catching it turns out to be a lot more difficult than they’d bargained for, they realize they may just be living the true adventure, in real time…!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Each pupil has been asked to bring a book to class and share their favorite story. Charley’s favorite story exists only in a very old book… when he arrives with his precious old volume, Paulie plants a doubt in Charley’s mind: it is not a real book but just a bunch of old, yellow, smelly pages!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is angry with Sam who stepped on her tail. Sam hurt her and she lost her balance. Julia doesnt want to talk to him anymore! As best he can, Sam tries to make up with his friend.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Daisy the railcar can carry passengers without having to pull any coaches. So, when Thomas is sent to work in the quarry for a spell and Daisy takes on his usual responsibilities, Annie and Clarabel are left behind. Daisy takes every opportunity to remind Annie and Clarabel that, as long as she is working Thomas’s branch line, they are not needed. But, when Daisy becomes popular with her passengers, she has to pull some passenger coaches after all! Annie and Clarabel get their own back by tricking Daisy into thinking she is need of repair. But two wrongs don’t make a right and Annie and Clarabel only end up being left behind in a siding… and then pulled along by dirty old Diesel! *Cough! Cough!*

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
